parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to an official campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Mircea Geoana and encourages voters to support the Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți.  This directly refers to a specific political party and, by implication, its candidates participating in the parliamentary elections.  Article 36 (7) - a applies.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  It is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. Therefore, it addresses the wide population. </addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The clear objective of the post is to persuade voters to support Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți. The call to action ("vote for...") is a direct attempt to influence the outcome of the election. Article 36 (7) - c applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. It is clearly promotional in nature.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal for votes for a specific party.  The context is purely electoral.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1328605544774777</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific political party (PRA), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the exact end date is not specified, the context suggests it's within the campaign period), has a clear electoral objective (to increase votes for PRA), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting.  The paid nature of the Facebook post further strengthens the argument that it is intended for wide dissemination and electoral influence.  The fact that it mentions Mircea Geoana, likely a prominent member of the party, further reinforces its electoral nature.  The only potential mitigating factor is the absence of a CMF number, but this is not sufficient to overturn the other strong indicators of electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Mircea Geoana</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>[Unspecified candidates of Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți]</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PRA</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 1328605544774777), care îndeamnă la votarea Partidului România în Acțiune Mehedinți și îl menționează pe Mircea Geoana, având ca efect electoral creșterea numărului de voturi pentru acest partid.  Postarea îndeplinește toate criteriile materialului de propagandă electorală conform art. 36 (7) din Legea nr. 334/2006, fiind adresată publicului larg, având un obiectiv electoral clar și depășind limitele activității jurnalistice. Absența unui număr CMF nu este suficientă pentru a exclude caracterul de propagandă electorală.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
